dns.label: DNS Records
dns.description: Retrieves A, AAAA, MX, TXT, CNAME records and validates configuration

issues.noRecords: No A, AAAA, or CNAME records found - domain may not be accessible via web browser
issues.reservedIP: A record contains reserved/private IP: {{ip}} - should be a public IP
issues.cnameConflict: CNAME conflict detected - CNAME records cannot coexist with A, AAAA, or MX records
issues.multipleCNAME: Multiple CNAME records found - only one CNAME record should exist per name
issues.excessiveA: Unusually high number of A records ({{count}}) - verify this is intentional
issues.noMX: No MX records found - email delivery to this domain will fail
issues.longTXT: TXT record exceeds 255 characters - may cause issues with some DNS resolvers
issues.mxIP: MX record points to IP address ({{hostname}}) - should point to a hostname

success.recommendation: Your domain's DNS configuration is accessible and responding normally.

warning.recommendation: Review the DNS issues detected. These may indicate misconfigurations that could affect website accessibility or email delivery.

critical.recommendation: Multiple DNS problems detected. These issues may prevent your domain from functioning correctly. Review and fix DNS records immediately.

emailAuth.label: Email Authentication
emailAuth.description: Validates SPF, DMARC, and DKIM configuration for email security

issues.noSPF: No SPF record found - your domain is vulnerable to email spoofing
issues.spfAllowAll: SPF allows all senders (+all) - this provides no protection against spoofing
issues.spfNeutral: SPF uses neutral policy (?all) - consider using ~all with DMARC for protection
issues.spfMissingAll: SPF record missing "all" mechanism - add ~all to the end of your SPF record
issues.spfHardFailWithDMARC: SPF uses hard fail (-all) which can cause deliverability issues with forwarded emails. Since you have DMARC enforcement, consider using soft fail (~all) instead - it provides the same security but better deliverability. See https://www.mailhardener.com/blog/why-mailhardener-recommends-spf-softfail-over-fail
issues.spfHardFailNoDMARC: SPF uses hard fail (-all). For best security AND deliverability, combine soft fail (~all) with DMARC enforcement (p=quarantine or p=reject)
issues.spfLookupLimit: SPF exceeds 10 DNS lookup limit ({{count}} found) - will cause validation failures
issues.spfLookupWarning: SPF has {{count}} DNS lookups - limit is 10, you're close to the maximum
issues.noDMARC: No DMARC record found - email spoofing protection is incomplete
issues.dmarcNone: DMARC policy is "none" - monitoring only, no enforcement against spoofed emails
issues.dmarcQuarantine: DMARC policy is "quarantine" - consider upgrading to "reject" for maximum protection
issues.dmarcNoPolicyDefined: DMARC policy not clearly defined - ensure p=quarantine or p=reject is set
issues.dmarcNoSubdomain: DMARC missing subdomain policy (sp=) - subdomains may not be protected
issues.dmarcNoReporting: DMARC has no reporting emails (rua/ruf) - you won't receive abuse reports
issues.dmarcPercentage: DMARC applies to only {{pct}}% of emails - consider increasing to pct=100
issues.noDKIM: No DKIM selectors detected - emails cannot be cryptographically verified
issues.dkimNote: Note: Checked ~40 common DKIM selectors used by major email providers. Custom/random selectors cannot be discovered via DNS queries alone.
issues.dkimVerify: To verify DKIM is configured, try: 1) Check your email provider's documentation for your selector name, 2) Use EasyDMARC's free DKIM Lookup tool (https://easydmarc.com/tools/dkim-lookup) to auto-detect, or 3) Inspect email headers from sent emails for the DKIM-Signature "s=" parameter
issues.dkimFound: Found DKIM selector(s): {{selectors}}. Additional selectors may exist but cannot be automatically discovered.

aggregate.fullAuth: ✓ Email authentication fully configured with enforcement
aggregate.noEnforcement: ⚠ Email authentication configured but DMARC not enforcing (p=none)
aggregate.none: ✗ No email authentication configured - domain is vulnerable to spoofing

excellent.message: ✓ Email authentication fully configured with enforcement
excellent.recommendation: Excellent! Your domain has complete email authentication protecting against spoofing and phishing.

configured.recommendation: Configure {{missing}} to protect your domain from email spoofing. Review the issues below for specific configuration improvements.

partial.recommendation: Configure {{missing}} to protect your domain from email spoofing. Review the issues below for specific configuration improvements.

upgradePolicy.recommendation: Upgrade your DMARC policy from p=none to p=quarantine or p=reject for enforcement. Review the issues below for specific configuration improvements.

certificates.label: SSL/TLS Certificates
certificates.description: Analyzes SSL certificates from public certificate transparency logs

issues.noCerts: No SSL certificates found - if you use HTTPS, this might indicate a very new certificate
issues.expiring7Days: Certificate for {{commonName}} expires in {{days}} day(s) - renew immediately!
issues.expiring30Days: Certificate for {{commonName}} expires in {{days}} days - plan renewal soon
issues.selfSigned: {{count}} self-signed certificate(s) detected - not trusted by browsers
issues.wildcard: {{count}} wildcard certificate(s) found - ensure proper security controls
issues.excessive: High number of active certificates ({{count}}) - review for unnecessary or duplicate certs
issues.manyIssuers: Certificates from {{count}} different issuers - consider standardizing on fewer CAs

summary.none: No certificates found in transparency logs
summary.noneFound: No certificates found in transparency logs

noCerts.recommendation: No SSL certificates found in public certificate transparency logs. If you use HTTPS, this might indicate a very new certificate or the certificate is not yet logged.

expiring7Days.recommendation: Renew expiring certificates immediately to avoid service disruption. Consider setting up automated renewal (e.g., using Let's Encrypt with auto-renewal).

expiring30Days.recommendation: Plan to renew certificates soon to avoid last-minute issues. Set up monitoring alerts for certificate expiration.

issuesDetected.recommendation: Review the certificate issues below. Consider cleaning up expired certificates and standardizing on a single Certificate Authority.

validCerts.recommendationMany: Large number of certificates found. Regularly review and remove unnecessary certificates.
validCerts.recommendationNormal: Certificate transparency logs show your domain has valid SSL certificates with no immediate issues.

interpretation.okRecommendation: Certificate transparency logs show your domain has valid SSL certificates with no immediate issues.

securityHeaders.label: Security Headers
securityHeaders.description: Analyzes HTTP security headers using securityheaders.com

issues.unavailable: Could not retrieve security headers analysis: {{error}}

unavailable.recommendation: Could not connect to securityheaders.com. Visit the test URL directly to analyze headers.

gradeA.recommendation: Your site has strong HTTP security headers in place. Continue monitoring for new security header recommendations.

gradeB.message: Good security headers with minor issues
gradeB.recommendation: Your site has decent security headers. Review missing headers and consider implementing them for improved security.

gradeC.recommendation: Several important security headers are missing. Implementing these headers will significantly improve your site's security posture.

gradeDF.recommendation: Your site is missing critical security headers. Implement Content-Security-Policy, X-Frame-Options, and other recommended headers immediately.

rdap.label: Domain Registration (RDAP)
rdap.description: Retrieves domain registration and DNSSEC information via RDAP

issues.invalidDomain: Domain must have at least a name and TLD (e.g., example.com)
issues.noRDAPServer: No RDAP service available for .{{tld}} domains.
issues.legacyWhois: This TLD may not support RDAP or uses legacy WHOIS only.
issues.notRegistered: Domain may not be registered or RDAP server may be unavailable.
issues.expiringSoon: Domain expires in {{days}} days - renew soon!
issues.expiringWarning: Domain expires in {{days}} days - plan renewal
issues.noDNSSEC: DNSSEC not enabled - domain vulnerable to DNS hijacking/cache poisoning
issues.dnssecUnsigned: DNSSEC is marked as unsigned - consider enabling DNSSEC for enhanced security

summary.unavailable: RDAP not available for this TLD

incomplete.recommendation: RDAP lookup failed. This doesn't affect domain functionality.

critical.recommendation: Address domain registration issues immediately to prevent service disruption. Check expiration date and nameserver configuration.

warning.recommendation: Plan to renew your domain before expiration. Set up auto-renewal if available.

recommendations.recommendation: Review the recommendations below to improve domain security and reliability.

healthy.recommendation: Domain registration and DNSSEC configuration look good.

healthyNoDnssec.recommendation: Consider enabling DNSSEC for additional security against DNS spoofing.

sslLabs.label: SSL/TLS Configuration
sslLabs.description: Analyzes SSL/TLS configuration using Qualys SSL Labs (may take several minutes)

issues.scanError: SSL Labs could not scan this domain: {{error}}
issues.timeout: Scan timed out or is still processing. Try again later or visit ssllabs.com for full results.
issues.noEndpoints: No HTTPS endpoints detected for this domain
issues.gradeF: SSL/TLS configuration received grade F - critical security issues
issues.noPFS: Forward secrecy not supported - past communications could be decrypted
issues.noHSTS: HSTS not enabled - vulnerable to SSL stripping attacks
issues.hstsShort: HSTS max-age is too short ({{maxAge}} seconds) - recommend at least 31536000 (1 year)

summary.inProgress: SSL Labs scan still in progress (status: {{status}})

gradeA.recommendation: Your SSL/TLS setup is strong and follows industry best practices. Continue monitoring for new vulnerabilities and protocol updates.

gradeB.message: Good SSL/TLS configuration with minor issues
gradeB.recommendation: Your SSL/TLS configuration is generally secure but has room for improvement. Review the recommendations from SSL Labs to achieve an A grade.

gradeC.message: Acceptable SSL/TLS configuration with some concerns
gradeC.recommendation: Your SSL/TLS configuration has notable weaknesses. Disable outdated protocols, enable forward secrecy, and implement HSTS for better security.

gradeDF.recommendation: Your SSL/TLS configuration has serious security issues. Update to modern protocols (TLS 1.2+), fix certificate issues, and disable vulnerable cipher suites immediately.

error.message: SSL Labs scan could not complete
error.recommendation: The scan encountered an error. Try again later or visit ssl labs.com directly for a manual scan.
